name: Jo-Ann's Power Bars
author: Arielle C.E. McGovern
summary: These power bars are delicious and much more nutritious than most granola bars. They are very filling, too. Instead of using dried mixed fruit, feel free to substitute any of your favorite dried fruits. Same goes for the nuts.
ingredients: ½ cup wheat and barley nugget cereal (e.g. Grape-Nuts™)
1 (7 ounce) bag chopped dried mixed fruit
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Line a 9 inch square baking pan with aluminum foil
Spray the foil with cooking spray
In a large bowl, stir together the oats, flour, cereal, and cinnamon
Add the egg, applesauce, honey, brown sugar, and oil
Stir in the sunflower seeds, walnuts, and dried fruit
Spread mixture evenly in the prepared pan
Bake 30 minutes, or until firm and lightly browned around the edges
Use the foil to lift from the pan
Cut into bars or squares, and store in the refrigerator
